trs: \sqt{...I pick the leaves from the stems.}\\
\sqt{Once I have picked the leaves from the stems, I lay them out to dry.}\\
\sqt{Once I have laid them out to dry, they shrivel.}\\
\sqt{I’ve just broken the firewood in here,}\\
\sqt{in the hearth I want to start fire,}\\

src: Kaande,  kare,  va-kere   va-a-r-aŋge     ne   zi-sahane  zja   va-a-ragel-a       ko   daave.
trs: \sqt{Again, in olden days, women did not have plates on which they used to squeeze \textit{vuchima.}}\\

src: ...neva  mi-keno   ʤe   ke-mwaamo  ʤe-n̪ar-a ko-taŋg-iz-w-a     mo   zi-skuru.
trs: \sqt{...if games of Africans can be introduced to schools.}\\
\sqt{I pick the leaves from the stems.}
\sqt{Once I have picked the leaves from the stems, I lay them out to dry.}
\sqt{Once I have laid them out to dry, they shrivel.}
\sqt{twelve o'clock, then I will put (it) on the stove.}
\sqt{Once I have put it on the stove,}
\sqt{I will take it and wash it,}
\sqt{I will take the soup and put it in an earthen pot,}
\sqt{then I will put in it a little water a bit.}
\sqt{And I will put it on the stove.}
